subject: Re: FW: Menopause Mentor Training
preview: Hi Allie,  I now have the 29 emails from L'Oreal (attached) Can you please create the accounts individually like you offered?  I have created an email in the Zoom link - see below. I hope that's okay.

full_threads.body:
Hi Allie, I now have the 29 emails from L'Oreal (attached) Can you please create the accounts individually like you offered? I have created an email in the Zoom link - see below. I hope that's okay. Shelly x Hi team, I'm excited to be joining you with Dr Ginni Mansberg for L'Oréal's Menopause Mentor live training on Wednesday 8 October via Zoom. To make our session as useful and interactive as possible, please complete your Menopause Mentor e-learning before the live session. That way we'll all be on the same page and can spend our time together on Q&A, real-world scenarios, and the curly questions you actually get from colleagues and customers. What you need to do now
  • Look for your individual login and password (this will be sent to you separately via our IT team at Wolf IQ).
  • Log in to the Menopause Mentor course and work through the modules.
On the day (Zoom)
  • We'll keep it practical and collaborative: quick recap, then Q&A and scenario-based practice led by me and Dr Ginni.
  • Cameras on if you can - it helps us read the (virtual) room and keep the energy high.
Tech/help
  • Trouble logging in? support@wolfIQ.com.au
  • Can't find your password? Check your spam/junk folder first, then ping support@wolfIQ.com.au for a reset.
Thanks in advance for completing the course before the session - it means we can dive straight into the good stuff and make you even more confident Menopause Mentors. See you on the 8th! Warmly, Shelly Horton and Dr Ginni Mansberg

Hi Ginni,

No problem!

Thank you so much for trusting us!

Let me know if there's anything else I can do for you, always happy to help.

Allie I am so impressed- so quick and so excellent! THANK YOU!!!!

Dr Ginni Mansberg

Cofounder and Chief Medical Officer



+61402292079 ginni@dontsweatit.com.au https://dontsweatit.com.au/

Hi Ginni,

Happy Friday,and thank you so much again for your patience!

Just a quick heads-up: it looks like we won’t need a coupon after all. I checked how this was set up previously, and they used a company leader instead. So I’ve gone ahead and done the same on our end.

Here’s what’s in place now:
  • Company leader added: Joanne Nikolas
    • Email: joanne.nikolas@loreal.com
    • Password: (l6e9$k&pYQ4Q4VhM^)eDp@%
  • Through this account, Joanne can invite the 30 users directly
    • I can also do this for you, if you'd like 🙏
  • Each person will receive their own email, password, and course access
  • Once they log in, their progress will be trackable via reports

I’ve also recorded a quick Loom walkthrough here:
👉 Loom Video

Let me know if anything else comes up, always happy to help!

Loom guide:
joanne.nikolas@loreal.com
(l6e9$k&pYQ4Q4VhM^)eDp@%
  • create a user company leader
1:41
  • add it as company leader
1:41
  • she has to invite the 30 person in this link

Hi Ginni,

Thank you so much for confirming, that’s perfect! We’ll go with Option B and have everything ready for you this week.

I’ll put together both a short video and a written guide to make things super easy for participants, and we’ll also set up tracking so the L’Oréal HR team can follow everyone’s progress. I’ll double-check exactly where the HR team will be able to access this and come back to you with the details.

I’m so glad to hear everyone’s excited to get started, we’ll make sure it’s a smooth kick-off for them!

Ally. This is EXCELLENT. Option B please and yes for both of the short how tos!!
Thanks so much
They're champing at the bit to start!

Get Outlook for iOS

Hi Ginni,

Thanks for forwarding this through.

Before we get started, can I ask which approach you’d prefer for the 30 participants listed in the spreadsheet:
  • Option A: We create accounts for each participant with the course already available.
  • Option B: We provide coupon-style codes so participants create their own account and then use the code to access the course.

Alongside that, can I also confirm you’d like us to:
  1. Prepare a short “how to log in” guide to share with participants.
  2. Provide a way for the L’Oréal HR team to track participant progress

Once I know your preferences, I'll set this up for you.

Let me know if there's anything else I can help with, always happy to help

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Allie Borcena

Hi Guys
We are doing training for Loreal in October that incorporates our online course as part of the pre training. Alicia our prev admin used to sort this out for us and I'm embarrassed to say I don't know how to do this
Are you able to send me codes for the 30 people in the attached spreadsheet? And a quick how to log in? Plus how the team can see from the back end their progress?


I'm so sorry for this!




Dr Ginni Mansberg

 Cofounder and Chief Medical Officer

 ginni@dontsweatit.com.au
 https://dontsweatit.com.au/

We have the closed off the registration of interest on becoming a Menopause Mentor and it was a success. Please find attached 30 ready-to-go participants, eagerly awaiting their mentorship.


If you would like to send out the pre-training so everyone can get a head start, that would be great. I'm assuming you will also send out the official invitation for the 8 Oct or should it be from our end?


Looking forward to it,

Kind Regards,

That's wonderful news!
Here are the answers to your questions;
  1. If we have less than 30 people sign up for the training, will the cost remain the same?

Yes. We recommend a maximum of 30 people per group. We recommend someone from HR/ people and culture attend even if they do not plan to become MMs

  1. What date are you available to run the training?
I am just looking at Shelly's availability. We have the following availability in September;

10th 9-12

Do any of these work?

No it is exclusive of GST
  1. Will you create a link for people to register, or do we?
We can create the link. It will be housed on zoom. But also happy for you to host- whatever works better for you guys!
We will send over the links to do the online course 2 weeks before the training- which will be assumed knowledge g.

Hope that helps?

EXTERNAL EMAIL: BE VIGILANT

Hey Joanne
So lovely to hear from you again!

We loved working with the amazing team at L'Oreal

Here is some info;

Menopause Mentor Training: Empowering Peer-to-Peer Support in the Workplace
Why Menopause Mentors Matter
Research shows that people going through perimenopause and menopause overwhelmingly prefer to seek support from peers, not managers or HR. A 2021 study found that 83% of women felt menopause affected their work, yet only 30% felt comfortable speaking to their manager about it. Peer support networks, backed by expert knowledge and empathy, offer a practical, powerful alternative.
In fact, according to global best practices and the Australasian Menopause Society, peer support is a key driver of workplace wellbeing, helping employees navigate menopause, build social connection, and feel supported in their daily work lives.
Our Don't Sweat It Menopause Mentor Training is designed to create credible, approachable, and well-informed mentors. Menopause mentors are people who are ready to support their colleagues with empathy and evidence-based knowledge.
What the Training Involves
This is not just another health session. It's a science-backed, communication-focused learning experience that prepares participants to lead peer-to-peer support networks across their workplace.

✔️ Format:
  • 3-hour online training session (for up to 30 people)
  • $15,000* flat fee, including access to all materials and our online course
✔️ What's included:
  • Pre-training Online Course (1 hour): Self-paced, mobile-friendly learning covering the fundamentals of perimenopause and menopause. Completion is assumed before the live session.
  • Live Mentor Training (3 hours): Delivered online or in person by Dr Ginni and Shelly, both experts in menopause and workplace communication, the session covers:
    • How to support conversations-whether it's with bosses, direct reports, peers, or partners
    • How to create your peer to peer support network charter
    • Case based training on managing menopause in the workplace

(Chatham House rules apply)

  • 8 downloadable Fact Sheets to share within your peer-to-peer network, covering topics like:
    • Menopause insomnia
    • Brain fog
    • Managing mood changes
    • Navigating heavy bleeding at work
    • And more

Who Can Be a Menopause Mentor?
Menopause mentors can be:
  • People currently experiencing perimenopause or menopause
  • Those who've gone through it and want to give back
  • Supportive colleagues who want to understand and advocate for others
What matters most? Empathy, patience, and a desire to help-backed by expert training.

Flexible Delivery Options
We offer full flexibility in how you host the session:
  • Online for remote or distributed teams
  • In person at your office or an external venue (available on request)
  • Globally accessible for organisations with international teams
Why It Works
Our training addresses not just the "what" of menopause, but also the "how"- how to talk about it, how to support others, and how to create an open, inclusive culture. We blend:
  • The latest clinical evidence
  • Proven workplace communication strategies
  • Real-world empathy and understanding
In line with the Australian Government's priority to support older women's workforce participation, and the global call to make menopause less of a taboo and more of a supported life stage, menopause mentors are a simple but powerful step toward a healthier, more inclusive workplace.

Is this of interest to you?

*Because we have worked with L'Oreal before we would like to extend a 30% discount for this training, if you sign up by the end of September!

Warm regards,
Ginni

Dr Ginni Mansberg

 Cofounder and Chief Medical Officer

How can we help

Hi there,
We are at the final home stretch of publishing our Menopause policy, and to truly anchor this vital policy and foster a supportive environment, we believe establishing a team of Menopause Ambassadors would be an invaluable initiative.
Seeing as you provide Menopause Mentor Training, we would like to explore this option. Could you please provide information on your availability in running this program, potentially we could run it in our offices or online.
Please let me know what other information you require,
